title: A Residential Permaculture Design in under 30 seconds

tasks.task: Drive a tractor and attach implements.
subtasks: Sit in the tractor seat.
Operate the steering wheel to turn the tractor.
Engage the clutch and press the pedal to start the tractor.
Shift into gear using the shifter.
Adjust the throttle to control speed.
Hook up the tiller implement.
Use the hydraulic system to lower the tiller.
Monitor the depth and width of the tiller's blades.
Stop the tractor and disengage the tiller.
Drive the tractor to another field or location.

tasks.task: Operate a tiller implement on a farm.
subtasks: Attach the tiller blades to the tractor's drawbar.
Lower the tiller into the soil using hydraulic lift.
Control the tiller's depth and angle with hydraulics.
Maneuver the tractor and tiller to cover the desired area.
Adjust the tiller's settings to achieve proper soil preparation.
Analyze the current condition of the soil.
Determine the appropriate tillage depth for the crop.
Choose the correct tiller settings (e.g., blade spacing, speed).
Evaluate the effectiveness of the first pass and make adjustments.

tasks.task: Check the clutch engagement during tractor operation.
subtasks: Ensure the clutch is properly engaged before shifting gears.
Release the clutch gradually when starting the tractor.
Identify the current gear position.
Use the clutch to disengage the transmission momentarily.
Move the shift lever to the desired gear.
Release the clutch smoothly and engage the new gear.

tasks.task: Control soil depth with a tiller implement.
subtasks: Adjust the hydraulic gauge to set the desired tillage depth.
Monitor the tiller blades as they work to confirm depth.

tasks.task: Monitor the progress of soil preparation.
subtasks: Walk behind the tractor to observe the tiller's path.
Check for any missed areas or uneven tillage.
Look for clumps or large debris that need further attention.

tasks.task: Apply fertilizer using a spreader attached to the tractor.
subtasks: Connect the fertilizer spreader to the tractor's hitch.
Fill the spreader with the appropriate fertilizer.
Adjust the speed of the spreader for even application.
Monitor the distribution pattern from the spreader.
Drive the tractor over the field with the spreader activated.
Maintain a steady speed to ensure even coverage.

tasks.task: Clean up the work area after completing the tillage.
subtasks: Check for any equipment that needs adjustment or repair.
Ensure all implements are securely stored.
Return the tractor and implements to their designated areas.
